title: EXECUTED: The Terrible Truth About Jungle Monsters

replies.body: Please never stop releasing your data, I love seeing League by numbers :3
I love how they added {{champion:427}} executes into this
afraid to say that one of those ivern executes was me :)
Raptors really need a nerf though, or at least make the raptors clump up less. Midlaners still have no issue stealing chickens but right now they make alot of low elo junglers depressed.

Oh do they? would you mind sharing your source, as a low elo jungler, I don't remember being interviewed on this one.

If you don't have decent aoe they are hard to take on the first clear.
No nerf needed, learn the game, don't change it :P

I dunno, it just makes me depressed whenever I see someone in my game, on my own team or the enemy team, gets executed by raptors. However I find when I play mid I can generally just use an aoe ability to take all the little chickens over the wall after a few levels and deny the enemy jungler alot of gold.

I'm pretty sure they were trying to change up path diversity for junglers. Rather than there being "the one truth path, maximum gold and xp, you're a noob for doing anything else."

For instance, a lot of the AP junglers, think {{champion:79}} {{champion:60}} are more than able to take raptors in their first clear, because all the babies are like one auto attack away from death after the aoe initiation. whereas {{champion:203}} {{champion:76}} need to be a little further into the game to take those camps.

It makes invades and counter jungling more interesting, when you are able to make predictions on where the jungler is based off of what path they would now be taking.

yes, I do understand that they tried to make it so that different champions do better with different clear paths but I dunno, it just feels  bad when people get executed, even the enemy. Also when are wolves getting a buff to meet the standards of the rest of the jungle camps, because wolves do basically no damage compared to the other camps, and maybe all I want is a tip in the loading screen to pop up sometimes like 'beware the raptors' just as a friendly reminder, that maybe it might not be the best idea to try to take raptors when you're below 1/4hp.
Didnt the top singed player(mastery score wise) get banned for playing singed sup with smite, and now its okay?
You can get banned for picking certain champs?
Some people got banned for playing Olaf when he was very underpowered at the time.

SIon mains FTW
{{champion:14}}

I just thought of the best idea. Imagine if riot gave all the jungle camps 1% crit chance. It's certainly make the jungling experience alot more interesting and would make it a little more exciting when you're trying to clear raptors early on.
i like how i didn't see master {{champion:11}}
Like actually HOW? {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
How does ivern get executed?{{champion:427}} {{item:3070}}
Might be just me but i've executed to my lord and saviour gromp than the flithy  raptors but thats just me

According to these stats, yes it looks like it is _just_ you :P

At what point in your first clear are you taking gromp?
start blue then gromp? it's a decent path if you are a single target jungler such as khazix or warwick or jax.

Why the fuck is Graves still allowed to keep his 120/120 resistance in jungle? Stop! You have literal evidence right here that he has the lowest amount of executions barring Ivern. Make the refresh champion only for fucks sake!
Why do wukong, twitch and kayle make it onto the junglers list but rammus doesn't get onto either. Guess he doesn't get executed enough. Be interested to see the full lists though.
or shaco wth
if in doubt, Just recall and then proceed to Jungle camp
but recalling before 650 is tragic.
{{champion:119}}
lol
